strings.Value: "Our kingdom and our very lives are hanging by a thread. Let's postpone the wedding until the victory!"
"I have no idea what I'd do without you."
"It's not difficult to perform a miracle if you have somebody to do it for!"
"I love you, but I don't want a wedding. There's no ritual that could make us closer than we already are."
{n}Tonight Octavia and Regongar are especially passionate. When everything is over, the three of you lay there for a while, holding each other and panting, unable to let go.{/n}
"It's a miracle we're together. Everything was against us, but here we are. Alive... And even happy!"
"{Name} is a miracle. Who else could gather such a team of pariahs, exiles and outcasts? And not just gather, but give each of them a new home and another chance?"

"That's so true. Listen..." {n}A wild sparkle lights up Octavia's eyes.{/n} "I'm going to say something, just don't laugh. Let's... get married! All three of us! {Name}, you're the {mf|King|Queen} — who's going to stop you?"
"Are you serious? You've always been against all that sort of..." {n}Regongar waves his hand.{/n} "What about your freedom?"

{n}Octavia shrugs.{/n} "Maybe I've grown up a little. Or maybe I just learned to tell the difference between dangerous strangers threatening my freedom, and the people I love. I've said a lot of harsh things to both of you. I was afraid of everything in the world, even you. But now I'm not. Now I realize that we can only really be free when we're together."
"Deal! Now we have another reason to win no matter what it takes!"
"You're right. A ritual won't change anything. We're together — and that can never be changed."

"Yes. Now there's only one thing left to do — face the powers of this world and another, and tear them all to pieces. People, monsters, fey, gods — doesn't matter. Everyone who wants to take away our future. And then…"
{n}The half-orc smiles.{/n} "Then there will be just the three of us."
"So we really met for a reason. The gods aren't good for much, of course, but sometimes they send gifts... Like the three of us to each other."
"That's true. Fugitives and outcasts like us should love each other and do miracles for one another. Who else would do anything for us?"
